e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it provides a more accurate and honest representation of the company's financial performance. Although some investors may initially misinterpret the reporting, fostering a culture of transparency will ultimately build trust with all stakeholders and reduce the risk of legal issues associated with biased reporting.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and honesty, ensuring that stakeholders receive truthful information about the company's financial health. It is essential to establish clear communication about accounting practices and any adjustments made to reported figures. Additionally, the policy should promote fairness among all investors, allowing them to make informed decisions without bias or manipulation of information.
e6: Yes, I would ask management how they plan to communicate the change in reporting policy to investors effectively to mitigate confusion. Additionally, I would inquire about the steps they intend to take to ensure that retail investors can understand the adjustments accurately, as well as how they will measure investor sentiment following this change.
